comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Is that a "street" -- or a canal  ... or both?

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
Should be both: some kind of unpaved street (a carriage is moving round the corner) and some kind of canal.
/Anna B

comment.author: 8139976@N03
comment._content: The creek is called the Zillierbach, and the view is not far from the Schöne Ecke (Beautiful Corner); in fact, the houses in the center may be part of that street.

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
xiphophilos: Thank you so much for the information! According to the map, the narrow street seen on the photo above should be called Schöne Ecke as well - do you agree? 
/Anna B.

comment.author: 8139976@N03
comment._content: Yes, that's right, the street is called Schöne Ecke too. The area still looks very similar today. At the time the picture was taken the castle was the seat of Otto von Stolberg-Wernigerode, a childhood friend of Bismarck and then the Vice Chancellor of the German Reich. Otto commissioned a huge refashioning of the castle into the mock-medieval dream castle that you see. This remodeling was completed in 1885, so the picture may have been taken shortly thereafter (www.schloss-wernigerode.de/htm/de/html/SchlossGeschichte....).

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
xiphophilos: Great to have this additional information on the castle, helping us to get closer to the exact date of photography, of this image as well as others from Wernigerode by Curman. Thanks again!
/Anna B.
